meanings.definition: To sulk or be sullen in an outward manner.
meanings.sent1: After losing the game, Tim would outsulk in the corner, refusing to talk to anyone.
meanings.sent2: She tends to outsulk whenever she doesn't get her way.
meanings.sent3: During the family picnic, Tom decided to outsulk when his favorite sandwich was eaten by the dog.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds seemed to outsulk the sun, casting a shadow over the beach.
meanings.sent5: The child's outsulking behavior made it clear that he was upset.

meanings.definition: To display a sulky or sullen attitude outwardly.
meanings.sent1: Whenever she didn't get what she wanted, she would outsulk and make everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: He would outsulk by crossing his arms and pouting whenever things didn't go his way.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to outsulk the dog by ignoring him completely.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds outsulked the bright sky, signaling an incoming storm.
meanings.sent5: Her outsulking behavior was hard to miss, as she made it obvious she was upset.
